meanings.sent1: They inwall the garden to keep the rabbits out.
meanings.sent2: The workers will inwall the new room for extra storage space.
meanings.sent3: The elves decided to inwall the cookies to protect them from the hungry children.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him seemed to inwall her heart, making it impossible for anyone else to enter.
meanings.sent5: The fortress was inwalled with thick stone to keep invaders at bay.

meanings.definition: To build or place within a wall.
meanings.sent1: The masons will inwall the secret compartment behind the painting.
meanings.sent2: They plan to inwall the safe within the basement wall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to inwall its toy mouse in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were inwalled, hidden behind a stoic facade.
meanings.sent5: The ancient treasure was inwalled in a hidden chamber deep within the pyramid.
